definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: pull, draw, tear away, apart, off (NH id.; Targum [[נְתַק]] in der. species (rare), pull off, tear off; Chr Pal Aram. ntq shake off, Schwally:Idiot. 58; Ar. nataqa pull off, draw out, shake; Di:660 cp. Eth. nataga: natga: detrahere, etc.);—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. 1 pl. sf. [[וּנְתַקְּנוּהוּ]] consec. Ju Jdg 20:32 (on d. f. dirim. v. Ges:§ 20 h); Impf. 1 S. sf. [[אֶתְּקֶנְָ֑]] Je 22:24 (cf. Ges:§ 58, i); Pt. pass. [[נׇתוּק]] Le 22:24; —
draw away warriors from ([[מִן]]) city, unto ([[אֶל־]]) high road Ju Jdg 20:32.
draw or pull off ring from ([[מִן]]) finger Je 22:24 (fig. of rejection of king of Judah by ´[[י]]).
pull, tear away Le 22:24 (pass., of testicles, + [[מָעוּח]], [[כָּתוּת]], [[כָּרוּת]]).
be drawn away from ([[מִן]]) city Jos 8:16 (cf.

definitions.title: Qal 1
definitions.body: ); of soles of feet, be drawn out (from water) unto ([[אֶל־]]) dry ground Jos 4:18.

be torn apart, or in two, snapped: of sandal-thong Is 5:27, strand of tow Ju Jdg 16:9 (sim.), cord Ec 4:12; esp. tent-cord (in fig.) Is 33:20, Je 10:20, so [[יִנׇּתֵק מֵאָהֳלוֹ מִבְטַחוֹ]] Job 18:14; metaph. of plans ([[זִמּׂת]]) Job 17:11.
be separated, in smelting, fig., [[רָעִים לאׁ נִתָָּקוּ]] Je 6:29.

tear apart, snap, c. acc. [[הַיְתָרִים]] Ju Jdg 16:9 the cords, v:Jdg 16:12 (+ [[מֵעַל זְרׂעׂתָיו]]); esp. c. acc. [[מוֹסֵרוֹת]], bonds (fig.) Na 1:13, Je 2:20, Je 5:5, Je 30:8, Ps 2:3, Ps 107:14; obj. [[מוֹטָה]] Is 58:6 (‖[[פַּתֵּחַ]], and [[הַתֵּר אֲגֻדּוֹת מוֹטָה]]).
tear out, up, obj. roots Ez Eze 17:9 (in fig.); tear out, away, obj. breasts Eze 23:34 (in violent fig. of Jerus. as drunken woman).

definitions.title: Hiph. 1.
definitions.body: Inf. cstr. sf. [[הַתִּיקֵנוּ]]: draw away warriors from ([[מִן]]) city Jos 8:6 (=
Imv. ms. sf. [[הַתִּקֵם]] drag them away like sheep to slaughter Je 12:3 (of ´[[י]]'s dealing with wicked).

definitions.title: Hoph.
definitions.body: Pf. (si vera l.) [[הָנְתְּקוּ מִן־הָעִיר]] Ju Jdg 20:31 they were drawn away from the city (cf.
